newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Visitors to HK up nine percent from Jan-March.
newsitem.headline: Visitors to HK up nine percent from Jan-March.

text.p: The Hong Kong Tourist Association said on Thursday that 2.9 million people visited the British colony between January and March, an increase of nine percent over the same period last year.
Arrivals from Taiwan showed the highest increase, rising 25.4 percent to 430,716, while visitors from China rose 17 percent to 625,079, the association said in a statement.
The number of visitors from North America, Australia, New Zealand and the South Pacific, Europe, Africa and the Middle East also grew.
Hong Kong, which will revert to Chinese control at midnight on June 30 after more than 150 years of colonial rule, has been predicted a tourist boom for the handover period.

The number of visitors to nearby Macau hit two million in the first quarter of 1997, an increase of 2.7 percent compared with the same period last year, the statistics and census department of the Portuguese-administered enclave said.
